children.text: The histories, struggles, music, dance, carnivals, and an endless number of ties unit St. Croix and Vieques. Performances, whether it be a protest, calypso, carnival, or USVI-PR Friendship Day, demonstrate a sense of solidarity through embodied acts that transmit the joyous and, at times, painful pasts and presents that will inform Crucian and Viequense futures.

Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands more broadly share histories that demonstrate the many aspects of empire in the Caribbean. While colonialism, coloniality, and enduring struggle continues to define much of the present, I hope to also highlight how a pan-Caribbean understanding can acknowledge both our differences, but also shared experiences to foment a rigorous solidarity that understands that which is incommensurable and that which is common.
The Caribbean contains multitudes. St. Croix and Vieques, two tiny islands, contain a universe. And performance is one way of exploring all the galaxies within it.
